item.title: cancer by the numbers
item.description: cancer therapies, by the numbers a long list of numbers relative to cancer therapies, to be memorized as thought aids 1 2 3 4 TABLE btn, btni FROM "" WHERE btn

item.title: chemo emergencies
item.description: chemo emergencies/urgencies/toxicity overview platinum agents [[taxane]] hypersensitivity double check chemo plans, also triple remind the pts (home-based regimens, they will need to remember to take the steroids, etc.

item.title: chemo overview
item.description: chemotherapy overview [[anthracyclines]] naturally occuring (“bicin”, “mycin”) ~8 proposed MOA limited by: myelosuppression cardiotoxicity (lifetime limits on doses) [[dirty data]], [[adverse effects]] [[risk mitigation]]: often the total lifetime dose of [[anthracyclines]] is unknown, e.

item.title: dirty data
item.description: dirty data All data are dirty, but some are useful.

item.title: empiric antibiotics
item.description: Skin/soft tissue @eileen_hasse PO options staph: doxy linezolid clinda (diarrhea, often high levels of resistance) bactrim strep: keflex (true q6h dosing) cefadroxil (BID) amoxicillin augmentin (“amoxicillin plus diarrhea”) UTI Don’t treat UA w/o sx, unless pregnant or prior to urologic procedure.

item.title: equations in oncology
item.description: equations in oncology Standard Dose Intensity (SDI, amount rx) vs Delivered Dose Intensity (DDI, amount actually given), goal typically DDI/SDI >85% for curative therapies

item.title: hemepath-capstone-2022-07-12
item.description: hematopathology capstone 20% other == high concern for malig, but no guaranteed results (e.g. mono can have tons of “other” cells)

item.title: oncology alphabet soup
item.description: abbreviations [[CTCAE]]: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events link

item.title: Prophylactic Antibiotics
item.description: Fluoroquinolones? LVQ classic in cancer patients, but some folks starting to use augmentin. @eileen_hasse
